Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A topical approach to the study of the rise and decline of world civilizations from the first attempts to the great civilizations of medieval times.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Rise of modern civilization from 1500 to the present, with an emphasis on the confrontation between the Western and non-Western spheres of civilization. Honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Rise of modern civilization from 1500 to the present, with an emphasis on the confrontation between the Western and non-Western spheres of civilization.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Compares origins, development, and outcomes of the American, French, Latin American, and Haitian Revolutions.

WOH4208 - History of the Global Drug Tra.name: WOH4208 - History of the Global Drug Trade

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The global history of struggles over the production, circulation, and consumption of illicit drugs from the early modern period to the present.

WOH4430 - Law and Disorder: Piracy and M.name: WOH4430 - Law and Disorder: Piracy and Maritime Law in the Atlantic World

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: AMH 2010 or AMH 2020 or EUH 2000 or EUH 2001 or WOH 2012 or WOH 2022

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores crime and violence in the Atlantic World (1492-1800) focusing on piracy, maritime, and admiralty law.  Explores early modern courts and social construction of criminality.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The rise and decline of world civilizations from antiquity to the great civilizations of medieval times. Honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Compares the origins, development, and outcomes of the European Revolutions of 1848, the American Civil War, Cuban Rebellion, the Spanish-American War and the Mexican Revolution of 1910.
